title: Topological metal state in helimagnets
abstract:
A theory for nontrivial topology of band structure in metallic helimagnets is
developed. Two theorems on electron dispersion in helimagnets are proved. They
reveal a Kramers-like degeneracy in helical magnetic field. The generalized
Bloch theorem together with periodic boundary conditions lead to a nontrivial
topological band structure. As a result, an unusual spin structure of electron
bands appears. A 2D model of nearly free electrons is proposed to describe
conductive hexagonal palladium layers under an effective field of magnetically
ordered CrO$_2$ spacers in PdCrO$_2$. The spin texture of the Fermi surface
induces abnormal conductivity and nonreciprocity of electronic transport. It is
shown that the topological metal state is closely related to unconventional
antiferromagnets.
